channel.title: Compiling after i have edited client.java
channel.description:
Hi all i just edited things in my client.java and in autospawn.cfg
In autospawn.cfg i made 2 new npcs
In client.java i changed the items you begin with changed the text that you see when you log on ((E.G welcome to ----scape) and i changed fcguide command to ::commands
when i compiled my server and run it again my 2 new npcs spawned but nothing that i had done in client.java worked in-game so i thought maybe i didnt save it so i went into client.java but all my edits were there.. so i compiled again and still it doesnt change anything!!!
PLEASE SOMEONE HELP IM CONFUSED!

item.title: Compiling after i have edited client.java
item.dc:creator: @wat72 wat72
item.description:
@wat72 wrote:

[quote=“junior631, post:4, topic:260223”]@wat72 stfu

@xx qwertyuiop xx I compiled correctly … if i didnt compile then why did my npcs apear in-game ?[/quote]Why don’t you? You’re an idiot. Compiling has nothing to do with .cfg files. All compiling does is convert java source code into bytecode so the jvm can execute the code, starting with the main method. The npcs appeared because .cfg files only require a server restart and not a compile, since they’re not java files. Qwerty is right, you didn’t compile successfully. There you go. Now you stfu.

Read full topic
